projects.description: The Random Quote Generator is a simple quote generator that randomly chooses a quote from a list, along with various other information about the quote(who said it, what movie, year, etc.)

In this project, we had to take a list of various lengths, and divide it into pages of 10 people, and include the links to other pages.  Also, we set up a search box to search all names within the list.
img_descriptions: Divided into 10 students per page, with links to further pages

projects.description: I was tasked with taking a static form and adding functionality to it using Javascript.  Using event handlers, regular expressions, and form validation, I was able to add interactivity and functionality to the form
img_descriptions: Changes color depending on shirt color chosen, and keeps track of total cost
Functional validation of multiple fields, with relevant error messages

projects.description: This project involved using object-oriented javascript to create Phrase Hunter, a 'hangman'-like game.  A random phrase was chosen from a list, the board was set up, and functionality was added to all buttons.  Through event handlers, I was able to change the state of various objects, to further the gameplay.  The score is kept, and after 5 missed letters, the game is over.
img_descriptions: Currently randomly choses from nine different phrase, and sets up the board
Keeps track of which letters have been used, fills in correct letters, and counts down five 'hearts' before a game loss.

projects.description: This application was set up to send out an API request to a generic API, and to retrieve a list of 'employees', who were then displayed on the screen.  If you click on an employee, it shows a module with more information about this employee.  Search is also included, the sort through the 12 employees.
img_descriptions: Requests 12 random employees from an API

Click on an individual employee to get more information.  Click on 'Prev' or 'Next' moves to the previous or next employee, respectively, and clicking the 'X' closes the screen, to go back to the previous page.
